intro: Cortesia cuneiformis, commonly known as the narrow-leaf cortesia, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, adapting to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Cortesia cuneiformis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in mild climates.
